Comments_List: I was able to develop as a critical thinker. This course challenged me to think deeply about a given body of work. To really evaluate what the presenters are showing me and to ultimately form an opinion on the work that is evidence-based. It also taught many of the tenants of different research topics.

The class provided a broad exposure to various neurological disorders, both degenerative and developmental. The material covered in the course ranged from basic method/techniques used in biomedical research today, to clinical therapeutic development/application, along with everything in between. The structure of the course was very helpful for anyone interested in studying neurological disorders.
Excellent survey of neurological diseases and the methodology used in their diagnosis and modeling.

The basics of neurodegenerative diseases

Broad range of topics, small class size (facilitated small group discussions with faculty and classmates).

None
Terrific curation of guest lecturers to give a well rounded survey of different types of neurological diseases. More opportunities for feedback on assignments would have been appreciated.

I would 100% recommend this course to another student. During my two years at Yale University, this course has been the only course where I have felt challenged to learn. Both instructors were invested in the development and growth of the students.
Yes. Not too much of a time commitment (with regards to out-of-class homework), while having the opportunity to learn a tremendous amount from world leaders in their respective fields of research.
